[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
rapport my name is Dave and this is
episode 1462 a and today's date is
January 3rd 2018 and the thought of the
episode is the financial system will
break you cannot recover from a fake
recovery now before I get started I just
want to make an announcement I uploaded
an interview with Leo gums it is on the
x-22 Report spotlight YouTube channel so
all you need to do is go over to YouTube
type in X 20 to report spotlight and it
will bring you right to the interview or
you can go to X 20 to report calm or new
Sentinel com scroll down a little bit
look over your right hand side you can
play the interview right on the sites or
go to steam it that is steam accom /at X
20 to report and you can play the
interview right on steam it let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now it's starting to feel like 2017
all over again remember when we came out
of the holiday season we entered January
of 2017 and we got our first round of
store closings and Macy's came out and
said listen we're gonna have to close
some stores now during the holiday
season we knew that other stores retail
stores we're going to be closing and
here we are at the end of 2017 we're now
into 2018 and it's January it's the 3rd
of January and Macy's has come out and
says they're going to have another round
of store closures now of course the
corporate media's makin seem like oh
this was all planned and things like
that what they were doing is they were
going to see how it worked out in 2017
they wanted to see how the holiday
season panned out and it didn't so
Macy's right now is going to be closing
another 30 stores this is confirmed and
back in 2014 Macy's had about 800 stores
they are down 200 stores right now and
we're going to see other retailers say
you know something we need to close our
doors remember the numbers they were
giving us prior to the holiday season
where they're saying that retail isn't
doing incredible this is what the
brick-and-mortar stores needed they
needed this boost and they were saying
no look at this as four point something
percent
well it wasn't that it grew by force for
something percent it was that it was a
little bit higher than last year and I
think when we calculated it out it was
like maybe 0.4 percent higher than last
year which means the entire sales
structure for the brick-and-mortar
stores is absolutely awful and it's just
a little bit above what happened last
year and last year 6,800 something
stores how to close now if you're a
point four percent point five percent
point nine percent over that percentage
of last year is that enough to keep all
the stores open most likely not most
likely we're gonna see a lot of returns
we're gonna see the actual numbers
remember this number that they're giving
us is from the credit card company and
this occludes a lot of different things
the actual sales from the stores the
traffic that they had and their actual
profits that is going to show us what
they actually did and when those numbers
started to come out last year in 2017 we
realized it was a complete and utter
disaster and stores how to go bankrupt
they had a closed down and when we
looked at the percentages of sales going
from brick-and-mortar to online it
didn't match up yes online sales are
going to grow as time goes on more and
more people are gonna be going online
it's easier to do but it's still not the
apples to apples transfer of everything
going from brick-and-mortar to online
it's that's so far apart right now it's
not even close and what we're seeing is
that the entire system is breaking down
and it's accelerating of course nobody
wants to admit to this because everyone
is out there trying to convince us and
this is the mandate of the Fed where
they'll never admit that the economy is
doing poorly and those people in
government are not going to come out and
say hey listen you know we've had a huge
amount of problems here that the economy
is toast it's collapsing because to be
panic all over the place they're never
ever going to do it they're going to
keep it going and making it look good
until the very end until the system
comes down
and then they'll blame it on something
else because that's what they love to do
they love to blame whatever happens on
something else if things go right they
take credit if things go wrong they
blame it on something else we see out in
the rental market well it looks like
things are going south and this might be
signs that things aren't going well now
remember go back to 2008 when people
were losing their homes they were short
sales foreclosures a lot of these people
had to go and rent and rentals boomed
during this period of time and rents
went up now we're starting to see rents
come back down and we're starting to see
this in many different areas Seattle is
cooling off New York City the second
most expensive major rental market in
the u.s. the median asking rent for
one-bedroom Apartments fell by 3.7
percent from a year ago for two bedrooms
it fell by five percent and we are
starting to see this in other cities
like San Francisco Honolulu Chicago
they're all coming down Miami we see
rents are coming down by negative two
point eight percent Chicago is fifteen
point six percent San Francisco's two
point nine percent we're seeing Miami
coming down by four percent Honolulu by
seven point one percent and when we look
at this we could see hmm maybe something
is going on here and we're starting to
see that the push to keep these bubbles
up in the real estate market in all
these 20 cities that Case Shiller looks
at these are also starting to have
trouble where they're having a difficult
time keeping these bubbles as high as
they they are right now especially if
the Fed is going to start raising
interest rates it's going to throw a lot
of people out of the market who would
normally buy a house actually what we're
seeing over there a period of time
there's a lot of people that have
already been out of the market and this
is why mortgage applications really
haven't gone anywhere because most of
the investments in real estate are
speculators they're hedge funds
investment companies foreign buyers and
they're buying you know two three four
thousands of homes and eventually what's
going to happen is that these
speculators are going to disappear just
like they did in 2008 and you can have
all these homes and all these condos
they're just going to be open
and the same thing is going to happen
and we're heading in that direction now
remember they've been pumping the
bubbles up in these 20 cities the rest
of the US well the rest of the US real
estate market it is starting to fall
apart houses aren't hitting the height
of where they were in 2008 in many
places those prices are much much lower
traffic isn't as abundant as it was as
it once was and people are are lowering
their prices just to get people to come
out and take a look at their homes and
we can see that the retail market the
housing market has interest rates rise
it's going to put it's going to have an
effect on the student loan market it's
gonna have an effect on the auto loan
market and we're gonna see a lot of
things change we saw this prior to 2008
the Fed was doing the same exact thing
they were raising interest rates
very very slowly right at that time a
lot of people had adjustable rate
mortgages they felt the effect very
quickly and they said oh my god I can't
afford my mortgage I'm just leaving the
house as interest rates kept on moving
up and up and up and they tried to lock
in and it got out of control the same
thing is happening right now not as many
people have the adjustable rate
mortgages but it's gonna throw a lot of
people out of the auto loan industry
it's going to throw a lot of people out
of the housing loan industry where they
can't get these loans it'll be very very
difficult because as interest rates move
up you need to make a certain amount of
money to afford the house because when
interest rates are low you don't have to
make as much money to afford the house
that you want so we're gonna see things
change rapidly now the central banks
they are trapped and this is coming from
Charles Hughes Smith he wrote an article
why the financial system will break you
can't normalize markets and depend on
extreme monetary stimulus he said in a
nutshell central banks are promising to
normalize their monetary policy extremes
in 2018 but there's a problem with all
this you can't normalize markets that
are now entirely dependent on extremes
of monetary stimulus
you can't fix an economy where the
entire economy is built on an illusion
the recovery was built on an illusion
so remember back in 2008 in response to
the global financial crisis the central
banks they lowered their interest rates
to near zero in some places negative
they boost private sector lending
increased liquidity to enable private
sector lenders and borrowers to
refinance existing debt and generate new
credit they also bought assets
government bonds corporate bonds and in
some cases stocks via ETFs the goal here
was to prop up the collateral
underpinning of all the debt if
liquidity dried up consumers and and
enterprises would default handling
handing lenders catastrophic losses as
the crisis had crushed a market value of
the collateral the lenders would have to
sell to recoup their losses and so
central banks pursued an unprecedented
policy aimed at goosing private sector
lending and borrowing while boosting the
markets for stocks bonds and real estate
the collateral that supported all the
debt was at risk of default all this
low-cost easy
available credit coupled with central
bank's public messages that they would
do whatever it takes to restore the
credit mechanisms and reflate the
private sector markets for stocks bonds
and real estate worked credit expanded
markets recovered and then they all soar
to new highs but by lowering the
interest rates and bond yield near 2-0
central banks deprived institutional
owners who rely on stable high yielding
safe investment income insurers pension
funds individual retirement accounts and
so on of exactly what they need safe
stable high-yield returns in this
whatever it takes type of model the only
way to earn high return is to buy risk
assets assets such as stocks and junk
bonds and you can see many individuals
gone into the stock market gone into the
bond market
problem is central banks are now trapped
if they raise rates to provide low-risk
high-yield returns to institutional
owners they will stifle the recovery and
the asset bubbles that are dependent on
unlimited liquidity and Scylla and super
low interest rates will pop but if they
keep yields low the only way
institutional investors can earn the
gains they need to survive is to pile
into risk assets and hope the current
bubbles will lift higher this traps the
central banks in a strategy of pushing
risk assets already at nosebleed
valuations even higher as any decline
would crush the value of the collateral
underpinning the Titanic mountain of
debt the system has created in the past
eight years and Han institutional owners
losses rather than gains so can the
central banks raise rates without
popping the bubbles can they do this and
keep the system solvent well I doubt it
we've seen in the past when they raise
the rates it didn't work everything fell
apart why because most of it was built
on an illusion the subprime security
built on an illusion it was fake
information they weren't triple-a people
believe they were because we were told
they were the same thing today what the
information they're giving us the
unemployment the GDP the stock market
it's all fake information all of this is
going to come down and I think want that
the reason they're raising the rates is
so they can bring them back down again
think about what they did prior to 2008
the rates were low they started to bring
them up and they reached a point where
everything started to fall apart when
everything started to fall apart they
started to lower the rates again and
they kept lowering them it didn't help
because they already ignited the fuse
and it was burning and people were
getting out of the way people were
abandoning their houses and businesses
were coming down but
they kept lowering the rates because
they didn't care what happened in the
economy as long as they can bring the
rates to where they needed to go because
they knew they needed to do this I think
the same thing is happening I think
they're bringing the rates up as far as
they can get them so they can say when
everything starts to fall apart they
could say hey we need to bring the rates
low and I think they're gonna go
negative at this point and we can see
that this is all in preparation for the
collapse now we know that everything is
moving away from the West and moving to
the east we see that China and Russian
they've been preparing and remember this
is the central bank just moving their
base of operation to someplace else to
restart their system because their old
system is crashing of course they're
gonna blame this on something else they
don't want people to know that their old
system is crashing they'll say crash
because it may be Bitcoin because of
some type of distraction maybe war or
some type of an event but whatever they
do they're not gonna take the blame for
this and we're starting to see that
there is going to be a push to take
control of the cryptocurrency market and
I think the central bankers are making
this push right now where they're trying
to take control and force everyone into
what they want them to use just like
back in 1913 they wanted everyone into
their currency that they wanted to
create today they want the same thing
and the only way to do this is to create
laws to force people into it because you
can't just tell the Cinch bank just
can't come out and say hey you need to
use our Fed coin or our utility coin no
they need governments around the world
to tell their people to do this and the
only way to do this is to scare them
this is their tactic they use crash the
economy crash Bitcoin crash the crypto
system and say see what happens it's
very volatile it's very dangerous
without the central bank's managing it
and I think this is the move they're
gonna make now is this going to work I'm
not saying it's going to work but this
is the tactic they use we see already
out in China the PBOC
call for rectifying irregularities
intellect
use of some Bitcoin mining fields and
what they're doing is they're going to
limit the amount of power the miners can
use now think about it the entire
operation of mining Bitcoin and other
coins they're in these huge server rooms
where these servers are working and it
uses a certain number of uses
electricity to generate and to operate
these servers if countries even here in
the United States put a regulation in
place where they limit the amount of
lectricity you can use well guess what
they're able to stop the production of
Bitcoin - like corn or anything and you
can see that what they're trying to do
is they're trying to figure out ways to
regulate and that's the key word
regulate they want regulations to
control what is happening right now
and we can see that they might even tax
and again this is the central bank's
looking to take control of the currency
system I'm not saying this is exactly
what's going to happen or they'll
succeed in what they're trying to do but
they're gonna give it their all to try
to do this hopefully the people say no
we don't want this we don't want the
central bank's getting their fingers
into this but again it all depends on
those people in government those people
in government when the central bank was
trying to get into the system they were
paid off and they allowed the central
banks to get into our system and we've
had it since 1913 yes we've had other
central banks but Andrew Jackson removed
the last one and hopefully this time
around they don't have the ability to
get the government people to pass these
laws the people are going to have to
speak up and say no we don't want this
to happen we don't need these laws and
hopefully other countries do this so
what we're seeing right now is they're
getting everything prepared for the
system
to come down they want control of the
cryptocurrency
they want their system moved from the
west to the east they want everything in
place and it looks like they're almost
there we're heading to this time period
of where they're gonna have no choice
but to eventually bring it down because
if they don't bring it down it's gonna
come down on its own and they won't be
able to control it and they don't like
losing control they like having full
control of when these things happen and
it looks like they've been trying to
keep this afloat for this period of time
until they can figure out a way to
distract everyone away from the real
reason of why the economy is coming down
and that's because it's their system
their system always comes down after a
certain number of years they can't keep
it operational so they have to restart
it and this is what we're seeing right
now we're at that time period so no
matter what we're heading towards a
transition this is why you need to be
prepared and ready
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
